name: Bells Through History! Quiz | Thematic Objects | 15 Questions

questions.text: According to Victor Hugo's famous novel, who worked as a bellringer at the Cathedral of Notre Dame?
questions.correct: Quasimodo & hunchback & the hunchback & hunchback of Notre Dame & the hunchback of Notre Dame
questions.explanation:
Quasimodo & hunchback & the hunchback & hunchback of Notre Dame & the hunchback of Notre Dame.

	He was deaf because of the noise of the bells.

questions.text: Which famous psychologist studied conditioned responses by ringing bells whenever he fed a group of dogs?
questions.explanation:
Pavlov.

	The dogs learned to salivate at the ringing of a bell -- even when no food accompanied it.

questions.text: According to the Christmas carol, 'Silver Bells,' when you 'hear them ring' what sound will you hear?
questions.explanation:
Ring-a-ling.

	'Ring-a-ling, Hear them ring!, Soon it will be Christmas day!'

questions.text: According to the Christmas song 'Carol of the Bells' what 'is their song'?
questions.explanation:
Ding dong, ding dong.

	'Ding dong, ding dong, That is their song, With joyful ring, All caroling.'

questions.text: What word is used to refer to the pre-Civil War U.S. South?
questions.explanation:
anteBELLum.

	From the Latin -- 'ante' means before (or maybe that's Greek), and 'bellum' means war

questions.text: What man with a ringing name is usually credited with inventing the telephone?
questions.explanation:
Alexander Graham Bell & Bell.

	The word 'decibel' -- a unit of measurement for volume of sound -- comes from his name. It has come into question, however, whether he actually deserves credit; the idea may first have come from Antonio Meucci, an Italian immigrant to the U.S. who didn't have the money to file a patent. The U.S. Congress passed a resolution recognizing Meucci's contributions in 2002. Ten days later, the Canadian Parliament passed a resolution reiterating their support of Bell's claim to the telephone's invention.

questions.text: One of these words can complete two common expressions: "______ of bells" and "_____ of laughter." Which word is it?
questions.explanation:
peal.

	For bell ringers, peals, half-peals and quarter peals are arrangements of multiple, harmonious bells.

questions.text: What Philadelphia Bell is famously cracked?
In the 19th century (and today too, but less so), beauties from the American South were known by what word, from the French meaning 'beautiful'?
What is the capital of Serbia?
questions.explanation:
Belgrade.

	Belfast is the capital of Northern Ireland, Kosovo was a disputed province of Serbia and has now declared independence, and Sarajevo is the capital of Bosnia.

questions.text: What word is used for a musical instrument consisting of an arrangement of bells?
A bell rings at the most holy part of the Catholic Mass, when Catholics believe that the bread and wine literally become the body and blood of Christ. What is this process called?
questions.explanation:
transubstantiation.

	Consubstantiation relates to the Protestant belief, that the bread and wine are only metaphorically the body and blood of Christ.

questions.text: What English sermonist admonished that we should 'never send to know for whom the bell tolls: it tolls for thee'?
questions.explanation:
John Donne.

	This is from the same sermon that states, 'No man is an island entire of itself.' "Meditation XVII" was published in 1623 as part of Donne's book "Devotions upon Emergent Occasions.
